page.title: 09Cramlington:Education
page.content:
First Schools are the first schools we go to. We start when we are four and we leave when we are nine. We spend five years in first school. In Cramlington there are 10 First Schools for the 2,540 younger children. They were built between 1968 and 1984. 6 are heated by coal burning boilers. The coal is fed into the boiler on an endless belt. The other 4 schools burn natural gas from the North Sea. Our favourite lessons at school are Mathematics, Art and Swimming (at the Leisure Centre). We stay with our teacher all day, every schoolday for a year. There are about 32 children in each class. We stay in school all day. A few children go home for lunch, most bring a packed lunch and some eat a school dinner.
Eastlea F.S.
